result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac J Lasiewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Organizer of Financial Crimes [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.88.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: sentences in Chippewa County cases 14CF336 and 14CF378

miscConds.notes:
To be determined
Pursuant to an Order (DOC-31) dated June 30, 2015, $1,299.15 represents Restitution plus surcharge of $129.91.  May be amended to include joint and several.

Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $10 represents the mandatory statutory surcharge for 943 property crimes.    $250 represents DNA surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

No contact with:  Betty Johnson.    No contact with: Central Lutheran Church and their employees; RCU or Northwestern Bank.  No contact with:  Kayla Woeltge, Jacob Lasiewicz, Colton Melander, Israel Melendez, Nicole Weber, Shaylynn Gehde and Nathan C Johnson, without agent's written permission.  Not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.    Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, except for work purposes and with prior written approval of the agent.    Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs or involved in illegal drug activities.  Not to possess any banking account, credit card or financial information that is not directly in the defendant's name and/or without prior written permission of the agent.
Submit a DNA sample.  Absolute sobriety.
